Row.Text: Very well.
All right.
Certainly.
It is agreed.
Oh, very well.
I suppose I must.
Excellent.
Pitiful fool! Now we shall destroy you!
You worthless Barbarian! You shall pay for your wanton aggression.
You bloated idiot! Now you must be destroyed.
It is with reluctance bordering upon self-loathing that I must announce that I plan to wipe your great civilization from the face of the planet.
With great sadness, I have determined that this world is not large enough to hold two great civilizations. You must be destroyed.
The exigencies of survival demand that I immediately conquer a large portion - possibly the entirety - of your civilization. Sorry.
You are far cleverer than I gave you credit for. I congratulate you.
You have shown remarkable skill and audacity. One would almost think you were Japanese!
Well played, my adversary. You have defeated me.
I am defeated. You are to be congratulated.
I can think of no better way for us to cement our eternal friendship than by you granting us this pittance.
Can the humble and friendly Japanese people ask a small favor of their great friend and ally?
You would do us great honor by sharing with us a pittance of your limitless bounty.
I'm sorry.
I must humbly disagree.
With deepest regrets I must decline.
Perhaps at some other time.
I beg your pardon?
We are most pleased and honored to meet the great leader and warlord.
This humble soldier greets the mighty warrior and hopes earnestly for a fair and equitable alliance.
In truth, the heavens have smiled upon us for leading us into your august presence. How may we serve you?
Good day.
Farewell.
Goodbye.
Until we meet again.
Go away now.
That is all.
Our business here is done.
Welcome.
Hello.
Greetings.
Good day.
Oh, it's you.
Well?
How may I assist you?
Let's hear it.
Go ahead.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Yes?
You were saying?
Go on.
And?
You are indeed the mightiest and most valiant foe we have ever encountered. It is an honor to have fought you!

Imagawa has 40,000 men marching toward this place? I don't believe that. He 'only' has 25,000 soldiers. Yes, that is still too many. So, Sado, you want me to surrender. What if we do surrender? Will you be satisfied losing your life that way? What if we hold like Katsuie wants? What if we stay here in this castle, lock it up, and wait until the Imagawas lose their appetite, stop the siege, and go home? We would prolong our lives for 5 or 10 days, and what we cannot defend will stay as such. We are at the bottom of the pit, you know, and our fate is interesting. Of course the misery is great, too. But this is how I see it: it's the chance of a lifetime. I can't afford to miss it. Do you really want to spend your entire lives praying for longevity? We were born to die! Whoever is with me, come to the battlefield tomorrow morning. Whoever is not, stay where you are and watch me win it!
With great shame and self-loathing, we must most regretfully decline your extremely munificent offer. We humbly beg you to see fit to improve your offer for our unworthy selves.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Almost…
We must regretfully decline your very kind offer. Can you not improve it?
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there…
Almost…
We must regretfully decline your offer as it now stands. We must request that you improve it.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost…
Alas, our great friend and allay, we cannot agree to your most fair and generous offer at this time. Please do not rain destruction down upon our unworthy carcasses in your wrath!
Unfortunately, we cannot agree to your kind and generous offer at this time.
We must most regretfully decline your offer.
We grovel in admiration at your beneficence and righteousness.
We are most pleased and honored to agree to your offer.
We are honored to agree to your fair offer.
We most humbly request that you look with favor on our proposed trade arrangement.
My friend, will you agree to the following arrangement?
Will you do us the honor of agreeing to the following?
It pains me - almost unto death - that I cannot comply with your most reasonable and fair request.
It is with great reluctance that we refuse your request.
We must regretfully decline your request at this time.
It is our utmost dream to comply with your slightest wish! You have given our useless lives meaning!
With pleasure!
We would be extremely honored to agree to your most generous and reasonable request.
I humbly thank you for your consideration.
Ah well: we probably didn't need it in the first place.
You are correct: we are unworthy of such generosity!
Thank you anyway!
Very well. I'm sure you have your reasons.
Thus will Japanese arms always triumph!
